context: The Estonian word 'agendid' is the plural form of 'agent'. It refers to 1) company or institution representatives who perform their tasks or intermediaries (like insurance agents, sales agents), and 2) secret collaborators for intelligence services, police, etc. (spies, undercover agents). The word can be used in compound words like kaubaagent (trade agent), kindlustusagent (insurance agent), reklaamiagent (advertising agent), luureagent (intelligence agent), politseiagent (police agent), and topeltagent (double agent).
